newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian rupee shade up v forward, steady v spot dlr.
newsitem.headline: Indian rupee shade up v forward, steady v spot dlr.

text.p: The rupee was mildly up against the forward dollar in early Wednesday afternoon trade but continued steady against the forward dollar, dealers said.
"The forwards are slightly down as expected," said a dealer at a foreign bank, referring to low overnight money rates.
In the spot market, the State Bank of India, a major player, was quoting at 35.7050, dealers said.
"People are slightly scared.. and maybe RBI (the Reserve Bank of India) will step in at these levels as it did yesterday," a dealer said.
"RBI's attitude is you make money but shoulder the associated risks," a dealer said, referring to criticism over unpredictability of the central bank intervention.
Dealers at some leading banks have been critical of what they call lack of clear signal on what exchange rate band the central bank thought was correct.
